column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turn

column2: 3. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: No.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column6: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Two way left turn

column2: 6. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 7. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column6: at the center of the road
column8: to the right of the road
column10: to the left of the road

column2: 8. When passing you should NOT:
column4: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column6: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column8: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column10: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.

column2: 9. Distracted driving:
column4: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.
column8: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.
column10: usually causes the driver to drive slower.

column2: 10. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
column8: a flashing red light

column2: 11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column8: look for a detour or another route.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 12. When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
column6: lock the ignition and remove the ignition key.
column8: set the parking brake.

column2: 13. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.
column8: use alternate routes.

column2: 14. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 15. What does this sign indicate?
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)

column2: 16. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: one hour.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column8: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 18. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 19. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: swing to the right side of your lane.
column6: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column8: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 20. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column8: Speed limit

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: Pedestrians must not cross

column2: 22. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column8: keep your eyes moving.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column8: Lane change

column2: 24. Before backing up, you should:
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 25. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a stop sign is posted.
